channel.title: ~Help thread~
channel.description:
[center][size=20pt]~Help Thread~[/size][/center]
[center]This is a help thread for people who cannot figure out their error. This will probably get flamed, but i have nothing else to do so post your questions here. I will answer the questions one by one so dont keep posting and posting. I will get to you as fast as i can.[/center]
[b]Currently helping:[/b] ~ScimmyScape ~gunztheduel
[b]Helped:[/b] ~i own all ~Teez
[size=15pt][u][b]Post Your Qestions![/b][/u][/size]

item.title: ~Help thread~
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

wouterscape:

I need to know how make cases i dont know please help!!

Basically a case number is the object/item ID.

This is an example of a case -

case 1531: if(GoodDistance2(absX, absY, objectX, objectY, 3)) { if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You get strength exp!"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(3157); addSkillXP((10000*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((10000*playerLevel[3]), 3); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } } break;

Notice that object 1531 is a door. In this example, it is saying when you click on the door, you get 10000 exp for the skillID 2 and 3.

Read full topic

item.title: ~Help thread~
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

Just waiting for it to upload.

[quote=“r1ch kid, post:34, topic:104438”]make sure you have this

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount <= 49) {//d long specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; sendMessage("You do not have enough special energy left."); } if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount >= 50) {//d long startAnimation(451); specialDamage = 18 + misc.random(5); specialAmount -= 50; }

and this

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount >= 50) { ProjectileSpec(248, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, AttackingOn, EnemyY, EnemyX); calculateSpecial(); hitDiff = specialDamage; usingSpecial = false; specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; }[/quote]

That’s what I’m using.

Read full topic

and this

if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 1305 && specialAmount >= 50) { ProjectileSpec(248, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, AttackingOn, EnemyY, EnemyX); calculateSpecial(); hitDiff = specialDamage; usingSpecial = false; specialDamage = 0; specialDamage2 = 0; }

item.title: ~Help thread~
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

[quote=“gunztheduel, post:27, topic:104438”]How do I make it so that an animation goes the right way if I attack a person?

E.g. I use a bow. A glowing arrow shoots out, but it always point south. So when I shoot somebody that’s north of me, the arrow goes backwards. How do I make it so that the arrow always goes towards the person?

How do I make it when I attack somebody, the GFX appears on my character?

E.g. I have special attacks. I use Dragon Longsword and I use it’s special. The animation appears on the other character at a wierd angle. The animation doesn’t appear on my Dragon Longsword; it appears on the other character. How can I solve it?[/quote]

Can you answer mine now ^?

Read full topic

item.title: ~Help thread~
item.dc:creator: @r1ch_kid r1ch kid
item.description:
@r1ch_kid wrote:

add this

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 1000000); addItem(550, 1); addItem(1856,1); sendMessage("The starter packet for ScapeOfDeath Players !"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack !"); } }

then add this above public boolean proc

public int starter = 0;

the search for

} else if (token.equals("character-lastlogintime")) { lastlogintime = Integer.parseInt(token2);

and under that add

} else if (token.equals("character-starter")) { starter = Integer.parseInt(token2);

now search for

characterfile.write("character-lastlogintime = ", 0, 26); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerLastLogin), 0, Integer.toString(playerLastLogin).length()); characterfile.newLine();

and under it add

characterfile.write("character-starter = ", 0, 20); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(starter), 0, Integer.toString(starter).length()); characterfile.newLine();

Read full topic

item.title: ~Help thread~
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

How do I make it so that an animation goes the right way if I attack a person?

E.g. I use a bow. A glowing arrow shoots out, but it always point south. So when I shoot somebody that’s north of me, the arrow goes backwards. How do I make it so that the arrow always goes towards the person?

How do I make it when I attack somebody, the GFX appears on my character?

E.g. I have special attacks. I use Dragon Longsword and I use it’s special. The animation appears on the other character at a wierd angle. The animation doesn’t appear on my Dragon Longsword; it appears on the other character. How can I solve it?

Read full topic
